result.execSummary:
The defendant John H. Matteson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly conduct - County. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John H. Matteson

State appears by ADA Michela Puerner.  Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Waiver of Attorney filed. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
Ct. 1 Criminal Damage to Property- domestic abuse >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct- domestic abuse >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, deft is competent to represent self: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 12 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to AMEND Ct. 2 to county ordinance of disorderly conduct forfeiture with paying $5.00 forfeiture and CC
COURT ORDERS: Cash bond posted be converted into signature bond and cash returned to poster
